response:
Magnetic resonance imaging is critical to confirm the location and nature of the lesions (demyelination) and to assess for dissemination in time. Lumbar puncture and serology are required to distinguish between MS and mimickers like NMOSD/MOGAD or infection, which have different prognostic and therapeutic implications.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Whole Spine with Gadolinium", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-Reactive Protein (CRP)", "Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)", "Serum Glucose", "Aquaporin-4 Antibodies (NMO-IgG)", "Anti-MOG Antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology (VDRL/TPHA)", "Lyme serology", "Lumbar Puncture (for CSF opening pressure, cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands)", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEP)"]
